sanskrit_verse:
बलाद्दत्तं बलाद्भुक्तं बलाद्यच्चापि लेखितम् ।
सर्वान् बलकृतानर्थानकृतान् मनुरब्रवीत् ॥ ८.१६८॥
transliteration:
balād dattaṁ balād bhuktaṁ balād yac cāpi lekhitam |
sarvān balakṛtān arthān akṛtān manurabravīt || 8.168 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Whatever is given by force, enjoyed by force, or written by force—Manu declared all such transactions as legally void and non-binding.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives only from conscious consent, not coercion
Causation must originate in free will, not compulsion
Capacity-based responsibility requires absence of external domination
Restoration logic nullifies all acts rooted in imbalance of power
Consciousness alignment invalidates contractual obligations formed under duress
executable_legal_axioms: IF transaction involves coercion THEN validity = FALSE
IF consent was obtained via dominance THEN enforceability = NULL
IF any party lacked autonomous capacity THEN contract_status = VOID
IF force influenced execution THEN legal_effect = NON_BINDING
IF imbalance_of_power EXISTS THEN restoration_protocol TRIGGER
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, any evidence of coercion renders a deed, contract, or decree automatically non-enforceable. The threshold for responsibility lies in the presence of uncoerced agency. Authority derived through domination is categorically rejected.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality establishes that actions rooted in fear or domination lack valid intention. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals the sequential distortion caused by force. Proportional responsibility rests solely with the coercing agent. The non-punitive reality rule restores affected parties to original integrity without retaliatory consequence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process to reverse coerced agreements
Realign involved parties' consciousness to pre-coercion state
Restore capacity of dominated individual through guided awareness
Nullify legal effects created under influence of force
Establish safeguards against recurrence of coercive imbalance
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Dharma. All force-induced obligations are dissolved. Justice is restored through consciousness realignment. Reality operates beyond punishment. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
